Sequence Information.Peptide Name: PR-39(16-39) (PR-39 fragment, Pro-rich, PrAMPs, Synthetic AMPs, UCLL1)
Sequence Information.Source: sequence truncation, cathelicidin analog, animal-derived, natural derivative

Literature Information.Literature: Sequence analysis: APD analysis reveals that this sequence is similar (68.57%) toPR-35F: 21%, R: 17%, P: 50%.Activity: active against E. coli (MBC 10 uM) and B. globigii (MBC 10 uM).Antimicrobial robustness: NaCl-sensitive:E. coli (100 mM); NaCl-sensitive:B. globigii (100 mM).SAR: activities of the N-terminal truncated peptides are susceptible to NaCl at 100 mM.
Literature Information.Author: Veldhuizen EJ, Schneider VA, Agustiandari H, van Dijk A, Tjeerdsma-van Bokhoven JL, Bikker FJ, Haagsman HP. 2014
Literature Information.Title: Antimicrobial and immunomodulatory activities of PR-39 derived peptides.
